item.description:
The Technology and Culture Forum at MIT presents:
The 15th Annual J. Herbert Hollomon Memorial Symposium

FROM IMAGINATION TO INNOVATION: PIONEERING SOLUTIONS TO GLOBAL CHALLENGES
A talk by Amy Smith

Amy Smith, MIT class of 1995 and a 2004 MacArthur "genius" grant recipient, teaches MIT's D-Lab and is the co-creator of MIT's IDEAS Competition. She is co-founder of the International Development Initiative and a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Mechanical Engineering.

Following Amy's talk: INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT NIGHT@MIT
A Reception/Expo featuring the latest, exciting innovations coming out of MIT
7:00-9:00pm at the MIT Museum

This event, in conjunction with the International Development Conference at Harvard , is free and open to the public; no registration is required. For more information, please go to The Technology and Culture Forum at MIT. Co-sponsors include the MIT Public Service Center, the International Development Initiative and the Dean of the Graduate School.

This is not a CMF event; FYI only.

This event is free and open to the public.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be outside smoking at times during the event. Please introduce yourself. S.
item.name: FROM IMAGINATION TO INNOVATION
